lead_intro: Have you ever wondered how smoking affects your body? Dive into the details of what happens inside your body when you smoke a cigarette.

quiz.question: What are the two main types of particles found in cigarette smoke?
quiz.explanation: The remaining 5% of cigarette smoke particles are called tar and they contain carbon or nitrogen compounds filled with nicotine.

quiz.question: What happens to the cilia cells in the lungs when exposed to tar particles?
quiz.explanation: Tar particles in cigarette smoke land on the cilia cells in the lungs, turning into a sticky brown substance that paralyzes the cilia, allowing toxins to get deeper into the lungs.

quiz.question: How does nicotine primarily enter the bloodstream?
choices: Through the thin walls of the alveoli
quiz.answer: Through the thin walls of the alveoli
quiz.explanation: Nicotine in cigarette smoke passes through the thin walls of the alveoli in the lungs and enters the bloodstream, reaching the brain almost instantly.

quiz.question: What effect does nicotine have on the heart rate and blood vessels?
choices: Raises heart rate and constricts blood vessels
Lowers heart rate and dilates blood vessels
No effect on heart rate and blood vessels
quiz.answer: Raises heart rate and constricts blood vessels
quiz.explanation: Nicotine causes the heart rate to increase and orders blood vessels all over the body to constrict, putting a lot of stress on the heart.

quiz.question: What impact does smoking have on the skin?
choices: Breaks down collagen leading to folds and wrinkles
Increases collagen production for smoother skin
Has no effect on the skin
quiz.answer: Breaks down collagen leading to folds and wrinkles
quiz.explanation: Chemicals in cigarettes trigger enzymes that break down collagen in the skin, leading to premature aging, folds, and wrinkles.
